body.p:
U, S, General hospital
Ashland Ky
March 30th 1864
To the Respectfuly
Thomas ,E. Bramlette
Govonor of Kentucky

I Beg leave of you honor to to in form you of my condition and the way I have been Dealt with I volenteard in October 1861 in the 14th Ky, volenteer Inft as 1st corporal and then I was mad 1st Duty Sargent
But on acount of disability and long absence in Hospital the Col -- has ordered me reduced to the Ranks

My Sergeon has Reported me Disabled fom Duty some months a go and I have Bin left here
on Such Duty as I have Bin able to do and I am willing to remain in the survice if I can be of any survice to my Contrary I am 37 years of age & served fifteen months in the Mxican Ware and now I wish to know if I am likely to Bec of any survice to the Relief of my contrary if I am not intitled to a Sargeant place in the invalid Corps and sargent wagers

I have the honor
To Be your Respectfuly
Thomas ,D, Cook

To His Respecfuly
Thomas. E. Bramlette
Govenor of Kentucky
